The GATE 2025 results for admission to the ME/MTech courses are scheduled to be announced on Mar 19, 2025.

  • The JEE Main 2025 Session 2 exam for IIT Delhi admission to BE/BTech, BArch, and BPlan courses will be held between Apr 1 and Apr 8, 2025.
  • The JEE Advanced 2025 exam date has been announced for the BTech course. As per the official website, the JEE Advanced 2025 exam will be conducted on May 18, 2025. Further, the application form will be released in Apr 2025.
  • The UCEED 2025 exam for IIT Delhi admission to the B.Des course is now over. The UCEED 2025 result announcement is scheduled for Mar 7, 2025.

  • Joint PhD (Jul 2025 intake) applications are open, and the last date to apply is Mar 18, 2025. Further, the interviews will be held from May 6 to May 12, 2025.
  • The CEED 2025 exam is now over for IIT Delhi admission to the M.Des course, and the result declaration is scheduled for Mar 5, 2025.

IIT Delhi Highlights 2025

Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (more popularly known as IIT Delhi) is one of the most prestigious universities in India. IIT Delhi has been ranked 4 under the 'Overall' category and 2 under the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF Ranking 2024. The institute has also ranked 1st by India Today 2023 under the Engineering category, and 1st by the India Today 2023 under the Engineering (Government) category. IIT Delhi is popular for its flagship programmes, i.e. MTech and BTech courses.

IITD was established in 1961 as the College of Engineering. Later, it was declared the Institution of National Importance under the Institutes of Technology (Amendment) Act of 1963. Over the years, over 48,000 students have graduated from the IIT Delhi in several disciplines including Physical Sciences, Engineering, Management, and Humanities and Social Sciences, and various other streams. Over 15,738 students have received their BTech degree from IIT Delhi over the years. Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi), through various departments and schools of study, offers UG, PG, and various other courses to students. IIT Delhi is also ranked 150 internationally by the QS World University Rankings 2025. It is one of the twenty-three IITs present in India.

IIT Delhi is planning to open its campus in Abu Dhabi. IIT-Delhi Abu Dhabi campus is the first step taken towards internationalising India’s education. IIT Delhi arranges a variety of events for students ranging from seminars, conferences, fests, and others. According to the latest placement report available on the official website for 2023, 50 students received domestic offers with a package of more than INR 1 crore per annum. Commonly asked questions
On Highlights

Q:   Is M.Tech costly at IIT Delhi?

A: 

The total IIT Delhi MTech fee for students belonging to the General category ranges between INR 3 lakh and INR 10 lakh. It may be slightly costlier than other government colleges. However, IIT Delhi is one of the most prestigious institutes offering an MTech in India. It is well-known for the value of money and return of investment that it provides.

The institute also offers fee waivers based on category and income slab. Additionally, IIT Delhi offers several scholarships and fee concessions based on merit and financial need of the students.

Upvote

Q:   Can I get IIT Delhi with 500 rank?

A: 

Yes, you can get into IIT Delhi with 500 rank. As per the IIT Delhi Cutoff 2024, the last round closing ranks ranged between 116 and 6102 for the General AI category students. There are a few courses available at 500 rank including BTech in CSE and BTech in Mathematics and Computer Engineering. 

The table provided below mentions the courses available at rank 500, for the General All India category candidates:

Course2024
B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering116
Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering204
Integrated B.Tech. + M.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing417
B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing Engineering332
Upvote

Q:   How can I get admission at IIT Delhi?

A: 

IIT Delhi admission is entrance-based for all the programmes (Except for PG Diploma). For the diploma course, selection is done merit-basis. Candidates who have passed Class 12 can apply for the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi undergraduate courses. More details around the admission process of some of the courses are provided below:

  • Candidates, who have passed Class 12 from a recognised board with an aggregate of 75% or above, can appear for JEE Main, followed by JEE Advanced and JoSAA Counselling to seek BTech admission at IIT Delhi.
  • Admission to MTech course is based on merit in GATE exam followed by GOAP counselling.
  • For MSc, aspirants need to apply with a valid score of IIT JAM and selected candidates have to further go through CCMN counselling.
Upvote

Q:   How much GATE score is required to get admission in IIT Delhi for M.Tech?

A: 

For admission to an MTech course at IIT Delhi, candidates must have a GATE score greater than or equal to the cut-off marks. The cut-off varies across the MTech specialisations and reservation categories of the candidates.

In addition, the cutoff list mentions the minimum marks and ranks that the aspirants should have secured for selection. The overall cutoff for GATE may lie between 350 and 800 marks. This cutoff range is as per an unofficial source and hence, is indicative.

Upvote

Q:   Who is eligible for IIT Delhi MSc course?

A: 

Candidates applying to a MSc course in IIT Delhi must fulfil the required eligibility criteria. Thus, aspirant must hold a valid bachelor's degree in a relevant stream for at least two years (four semesters) and a minimum aggregate between 55% and 80% or 5.5 CGPA out of 10.

For MSc cognitive science/economic courses, the accepted degrees are BA/BSc/BCom/BTech/BE/BStat/BMath or equivalent. The total course fee for MSc course is ranges between INR 30K and INR 3 lakh.

 

Upvote

IIT Delhi Popular Programmes 2025

Candidates willing to get admission to various courses must apply online on the official website. At the UG level, the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) offers BTech and various other courses to students. At the PG level, the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) offers MTech, MSc, MDes, and various other courses to students.

While IIT Delhi offers courses at the UG, PG, and doctorate levels, the most popular course at IIT Delhi still remains BTech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE). This is because IIT Delhi CSE is a highly in-demand field with a plethora of job opportunities and career options available for students. IIT Delhi BTech CSE graduates work in various industries, including software development, IT consulting, and data science at top-tier firms.

MTech programme at IIT Delhi is offered across various Engineering and Science disciplines, including Computer Science, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. IIT Delhi Admission Process and Important Dates 2025

The mode of Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) admission is online. Admission to various courses is based on merit and entrance exam scores. The accepted entrance exams are JEE Main, JEE Advanced, and others. Candidates willing to get admission to various courses must apply online on the official website. Select the required course and pay the application fee. Fill out and submit the application form with the required information. Candidates must submit the scanned copies of the below-mentioned documents while filling out the application form in online mode:

  • First and last pages of Aadhar Card/ Voter ID Card/ Passport
  • PAN Card
  • Admission offer letter
  • The latest passport-size photographs
  • Medical certificate (in case of full-time candidates)
  • Entrance exam scorecard
  • No objection certificate (only in case of part-time applicants)
  • Qualifying degree certificate
  • Qualifying exam mark sheet
  • Category certificate (only in case of candidates belonging to SC/ ST/ OBC/ EWS/ PwD category)
  • Sponsorship certificate/ Relieving letter (in case of full-time sponsored/ full-time working candidates)

Top online courses offered by IITs

IITD is a leading provider of online courses, offering a wide range of programs designed to enhance professional skills and knowledge. With years of experience in the industry, IITD has established a reputation for delivering high-quality, online training. Their courses cater to diverse learners and are delivered through various formats to suit different learning styles. Students benefit from hands-on exercises and real-world case studies, ensuring a comprehensive learning experience. IITD`s team of experienced instructors brings industry expertise to the classroom, preparing students for success in their chosen fields. With a high satisfaction rate among past participants, IITD remains a trusted choice for individuals seeking to advance their careers through targeted education.

IIT Delhi Faculty

IIT Delhi has a wide array of faculty comprising over 650 teaching staff with an excellent faculty-to-student ratio of 1:8. Out of the highly qualified and competent teaching faculty, around 99.82% of the professors are PhD degree holders from some of the top institutions across the world in relevant fields. Some of the faculty members have achieved national awards. Rukmini Bhaya Nair, renowned poet and linguist, is the HOD of the Humanities Department and an experienced faculty member. Other faculties such as Prof. P. V. M Rao and Prof Paresh Choksi are known for core course designs, live projects, and startup ideas in the Deemed University.

View Faculty Details

IIT Delhi Results 2025

IIT Delhi Results 2025 will be updated here once out. IIT Delhi follows a semester pattern, namely summer and winter semesters, and releases the results of each semester soon after the commencement of the respective examinations. IIT Delhi results can be checked by visiting the official website of the Deemed University. Candidates can access the result by entering their mandatory details, such as registration number and programme. Follow the below-given steps to check the IIT Delhi results:

Step 1: Visit the official website of IIT Delhi (www.iitd.ac.in).

Step 2: On the home page, click on the ‘Students’ tab.

Step 3: From the drop-down menu, click on the ‘Results’ tab.

Step 4: A page with asking details, such as the registration number will appear.

Step 5: Enter the necessary details and click on the ‘Login’ button.

Step 6: A result sheet will be displayed on the screen. Candidates can also download the result card.

IIT Delhi Top Alumni

The alumni of IIT Delhi are placed across different sectors such as Engineering, Marketing, and Human Resources among others. Apart from this, IIT Delhi's alumni have also been active participants in our society and represent the country nationally and internationally as social workers and entrepreneurs. Some of the notable alumni who have added value to the system of IIT Delhi are enlisted below:

Alumni Name
Alumni Photograph
Kiran Bedi is the first woman in India to join the officer ranks of the Indian Police Service (IPS), the 24th Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry from 2016 to 2021. She pursued her PhD degree from IIT Delhi's Department of Social Sciences
Chetan Bhagat is an Indian bestseller author and columnist. Five of Chetan Bhagat's novels have also been adapted into Bollywood films. He graduated from IIT Delhi as a Mechanical Engineer.
Sachin Bansal is an Indian entrepreneur who is best known as the Co-founder of Flipkart. He is also the 86th richest person in India. Sachin Bansal attended IIT Delhi and completed a BTech degree in Computer Engineering in 2005.
Raghuram Govinda Rajan (also known as Raghuram Rajan) is an Indian economist and the 'Katherine Dusak Miller Distinguished Service Professor of Finance' at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and served as the 23rd Governor of the Reserve Bank of India.
Deepinder Goyal is the founder of Zomato.
Sameer Gehlaut is an Indian businessman. He is the founder and chairman of the Indiabulls Group. He graduated in BTech Mechanical Engineering from IIT Delhi in 1995.

How to Reach IIT Delhi?

Prepaid and metered taxis are available from all major Railway stations and IGI Domestic and International airports. Nearest Railway station is New Delhi and Anand Vihar. IIT Delhi Metro Station is on the Magenta line (Terminal 1 of the IGI Airport is also on this line). Gate 1 is nearest to the Academic Buildings/ Central Library/ Seminar Hall. A shuttle bus can be availed from IGI Airport Terminal 3 to Terminal 1, and the same metro route as above can be used. Another convenient option to reach IIT Delhi is to arrive at the Hauz Khas Metro Station (Yellow Line), about 2.5 km from the IIT Delhi Campus. At the Hauz Khas Metro station, you can change to Magenta Line to reach the IIT Delhi Metro Station or take the Auto to the Main Building of IIT Delhi.
